intro: Tibouchina bracteolata, commonly known as the velvetleaf tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions. The flowers bloom throughout the year, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
